You are have a bracket in an incorrect place in one of the commands above it.
That’s what happened to me when that happened.

P.S. TellyNubby congratulations on moderator.
[/quote]
No. That would result in an error.[/quote]
No one time i was missing a bracket in a command so i added it to the bottom of the customcommand method and it worked and it gave me that problem

item.title: My pickup command has a glitch
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

ok i do my pickup command

public void showitem(int item, String s1, String s2) { sendFrame164(6206); sendFrame246(6210, 200, item); sendFrame126(s1, 6207); sendFrame126(s2, 6208); }

[code] if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && playerRights >= 1) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(token[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(token[2]);

            if (newItemID >= 0 && newItemAmount > 0) { 
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
	    showitem(newItemID, "You use ::pickup " + newItemID + " " + newItemAmount + " and ", "you recive " + GetItemName(newItemID) + ".");
            } else {
                sendMessage("No such item.");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup # #");
        }
    } [/code]

works
then i do click here to continue and it goes hello sir how, what would you like to do?
and brings me to the bank

i know it has to do with the dialogs but i do not see why it is being called?

Read full topic
item.source: My pickup command has a glitch
